required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Central Venous Catheterization in Obese Patients With Compass Device

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm observational trial of a device (Compass Vascular Access, Centurion Medical Products, Williamston MI). The device is a compact, sterile, single-use extravascular blood pressure transducer. This pressure measurement aids in confirmation of appropriate venous access. The investigators plan to enroll 40 consenting patients with BMI ≥35 who require central venous catheterization for clinical reasons independent of the existence of this study. The primary outcome is operator satisfaction.

detailed_description.textblock: Forty (40) consenting patients meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria for this single-arm observational trial will be prepared as usual for central venous catheter (CVC) placement. The Compass pressure measurement device will be included in the CVC placement apparatus as per the manufacturer's directions. Data will be recorded on the placement procedure, operator satisfaction, routine patient demographics, and incidence of inadvertent arterial puncture.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implement used at time of arterial puncture, if any
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of artery puncture with either needle, guidewire, or catheter

arm_group.description: Procedure: Central venous catheter placement with extravascular blood pressure transducer

intervention.description: Listed device is included in central venous catheter placement apparatus for consenting patients, according to manufacturer directions

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting at University of New Mexico main/adult operating rooms who require central venous catheter (CVC) placement for perioperative care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI ≥35
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Adults unable to consent
- Non-English speakers
- Prisoners

overall_official.affiliation: University of New Mexico School of Medicine

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified study data may be shared with other researchers, pending final decision by study PI and sponsor
